title: First, find out how to get the probability that a computer lasts $$9$$ years and $$11$$ years separately. We know that $$m=0.1$$, and using the formula to find the probability at certain years, the probability of $$x$$ years is equal to $$e^{-0.1 x}$$.

We can alternatively use a PDF function to get the $$P\left(X>9\right)$$ and $$P\left(X>11\right)$$. Afterwards, we can subtract the probabilities from each other and set the value to positive since probability is always positive.
